sentences.english: Those under inspection shall report the situation faithfully and provide necessary data.
sentences.chinese: 被检查者应当如实反映情况，提供必要的资料。

sentences.english: Instead of running away from the problem, we are facing reality as it is.
sentences.chinese: 我没有逃避问题，反之我是如实地正视实相。

sentences.english: And Luke correctly passed on Paul's gospel.
sentences.chinese: 而路加如实传播了保罗的福音。

sentences.english: Funds should respond to the inquiry of donators faithfully and in time.
sentences.chinese: 对于捐赠人的查询，基金会应当及时如实答复。

sentences.english: Will people be discouraged if we point out this backwardness as an objective fact?
sentences.chinese: 如实地指明这种落后状况，会不会使人们失去信心呢？

sentences.english: What he said did not reflect back the views of the people.
sentences.chinese: 他的话没有如实地反映人民的观点。

sentences.english: The environmental monitoring institution shall accept the trust and faithfully provide monitoring data.
sentences.chinese: 环境监测机构应当接受委托，如实提供有关监测数据。

sentences.english: He tried to realize these events on screen.
sentences.chinese: 他试图把这些事件如实地搬上银幕。

sentences.english: Dissenting opinions in the deliberations must be truthfully entered in the transcript.
sentences.chinese: 评议中的不同意见，必须如实记入笔录。

sentences.english: The book allows us to understand the simplicity of insight meditation as it is.
sentences.chinese: 本书可以让我们如实地领会内观禅修的单纯简易。

sentences.english: You are trying to know what is happening as it is.
sentences.chinese: 不要试图令事物按你所愿发展，只需试图如实了知。

sentences.english: Recite to them the truth of the story of the two sons of Adam.
sentences.chinese: 你当如实地对他们讲述阿丹的两个儿子的故事。

sentences.english: Wahtever occurs, recognize it as right.
sentences.chinese: 无论发生什么事，都要如实地认识它。

sentences.english: Experts believe most problems are under-reported to the agency.
sentences.chinese: 专家们相信，大多数问题并未如实通报给FDA。

sentences.english: All the invoices must be filled in correctly and truly.
sentences.chinese: 所有的发票必须正确和如实填制。

sentences.english: The units and individuals concerned shall provide truthful evidence.
sentences.chinese: 有关单位和个人应当如实提供证据。

definition: to hand over/to explain/to make clear/to brief (sb)/to account for/to justify oneself/to confess/(coll.) to finish
to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
lit. count by fives and tens (idiom); to narrate systematically and in full detail
from beginning to end/in its entirety/in accord with fact/literal
to report to one's superiors/to appear in the news/to reply to a letter
lit. to put everything out including the tray/to reveal everything/to make a clean breast of it all
to report/to give an account of/report
to report/to give an account of/to collect information and report back
